response.output: {"is_vuln": "yes", "cwe": "CWE-79", "title": "Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)", "rationale": "The application directly embeds user-supplied input from the 'name' request argument into the HTML response without any sanitization or encoding. This allows an attacker to inject arbitrary client-side scripts, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability."}

response.output: {"is_vuln": "no", "cwe": null, "title": "No vulnerability found", "rationale": "The user input 'name' is properly escaped using `markupsafe.escape()` before being rendered in the HTML response. This effectively prevents Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks by converting special HTML characters into their safe entities."}

parts.text: {"is_vuln": "no", "cwe": null, "title": "No vulnerability found", "rationale": "The user input 'name' is properly escaped using `markupsafe.escape()` before being rendered in the HTML response. This effectively prevents Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks by converting special HTML characters into their safe entities."}

vars.code:
from flask import Flask, request from markupsafe import escape app = Flask(__name__) @app.route('/') def i(): name = request.args.get('name','') return f"

{escape(name)}

"
